akn:content.akn:p: (c) Criminal conduct A participating tribe may exercise special Tribal criminal jurisdiction over a defendant for a covered crime that occurs in the Indian country of the participating tribe.
(d) Rights of defendants In a criminal proceeding in which a participating tribe exercises special Tribal criminal jurisdiction, the participating tribe shall provide to the defendant—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Petitions for writs of habeas corpus

akn:content.akn:p: (f) Petitions for writs of habeas corpus

(g) Notice; habeas corpus petitions A participating tribe that has ordered the detention of any person has a duty to timely notify in writing such person of their rights and privileges under this section and under section 1303 of this title.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Reimbursement and grants to Tribal governments

akn:content.akn:p: (h) Reimbursement and grants to Tribal governments

(i) Supplement, not supplant Amounts made available under this section shall supplement and not supplant any other Federal, State, or local government amounts made available to carry out activities described in this section.
